Key Match Events: Gurpreet Singh Sandhu made a vital save early on to deny Kuwait's Mohammad Abdulah
Liston Colaco put in a low cross, but Hasan Alanezi stabbed the ball clear for the visitors
Eid Alrashidi broke the offside trap to stray clear on goal, but dinked the ball over Gurpreet
Jay Gupta burst forward and put an inviting low cross from the left, but Alanezi was on hand again to clear the danger
Brandon Fernandes flashed a low ball across the face of the goal, but it was Alenezi once again to clear the danger
Lallianzuala Chhangte picked out Manvir with an inch-perfect cross, but the latter nodded it wide of the near post
Faisal Alharbi's stinging volley from barely six yards out was met with a stunning reflex save from Gurpreet
Yousef Alsulaiman's effort was pushed out by Gurpreet to the top corner
Sulaiman Abdulghafoor made himself big to deny Rahim Ali, who had latched on to a great through ball
Rahul Bheke threw his body to make a solid block on Ali Matar's shot
Pre-Game Insights: India will now hope for Qatar's victory over Afghanistan, and a draw between Kuwait and Afghanistan on June 11
India will need a point for Qatar in five days' time in Doha to progress to the third round
Post-Match Reflections: Sunil Chhetri's 151st and last game for India ended in a goalless draw
Chhetri was given a guard of honour by the Indian players and team officials, and Kuwait's players and officials also paid their respects with handshakes and hugs
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu was named the player of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Both teams observed a minute's silence before the start of the match, in memory of Anil Kamat, Assistant General Secretary and Director, Competition, AIFF
India remain in second place with five points, while Kuwait stay alive with four points
Others: India's hopes for qualifying for the third round of the FIFA World Cup 2026 and AFC Asian Cup 2027 Preliminary Joint Qualification took a hit

Jay Gupta and Edmund Lalrindika made their India debuts, while Igor Stimac made two changes at half-time, sacrificing midfielder Anirudh Thapa to bring on striker Rahim Ali, and Brandon Fernandes replaced Sahal Abdul Samad
